name: hlatl

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c0, clc))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ HL, c0 ∈ AtLat, c0 ∈ CvLat)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, cal))
-| wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, clc))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clc), wcel(c0, cal))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ AtLat)
⊣ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ CvLat)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CvLat → c0 ∈ AtLat)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, cal))
-| wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, clc))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clc), wcel(c0, cal))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ AtLat)
⊣ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ CvLat)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CvLat → c0 ∈ AtLat)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, cal))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clc), wcel(c0, cal))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ AtLat)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CvLat → c0 ∈ AtLat)

comment: A Hilbert lattice is atomic. (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2011.)
